author: woody
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2021
review_content: This set has performed wonderfully.  Not super light, but pretty solid build quality.  We went with the blue color with no regrets.  Coloring has held up and they aren't scuffing too bad.  The coloring of the cases will come off if you scratch them against something, but the suitcase doesn't lose color, just some of the surface plastic scrapes off.Zippers feel decently solid, but we haven't put them in any extreme conditions to know how solid.  These are mostly used for road trips where we handle our own luggage, so no clue how they would hold up to airlines throwing them around.  I love having multiple sizes to choose from and we most frequently use the middle 2 sizes.  The smallest suitcase is too small for much more than a day trip, but the 2 medium sizes last me for most long weekend or short week trips with no issues(including a couple pairs of shoes in the case and some camera equipment).  For a couple, the largest 3 would probably suit most of your needs for a week, unless you pack super heavy.I would definitely recommend them and the wheels have not given us any issues yet.  It's nice that the wheels are casters that roll in all directions on all 4 corners so you don't have to tilt the case to move them, but that also means if you are on an incline you need to lay them on their sides so they don't roll away.  All things have ups and downs, but ultimately my appreciation for the casters outweighs any inconvenience.Over all, I'd say these are a great buy and we haven't really seen any significant down sides to the set.  We've had them for almost 2 years and while we aren't frequent travelers, they've seen their share of somewhat rugged trips going to Rally Cross events as well as a few trips visiting family.  Very convenient and store nested very nicely, to take up minimal space when not in use.
title: Great set for the price.

author: Andrew Davis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2019
review_content: Used all of these brand new suitcases for three flights this summer, one of which was international (Denver to Munich). They handled well and are sturdy enough. Some corners were slightly damaged (aesthetically speaking) by bumping into or hitting other luggage on conveyor belts during ground transportation at the airport. Other than that, we are very happy with the ease and comfort of these suitcases as they've worked well for us, despite being maxed out at 50.0lbs each at the airport scales (we pack really well, aided by a home scale) and had repacked items at home between the suitcases in order to find the best fit so it wasn't overstuffed.Buyer's notes: be sure you realize these are not expandable or are meant to expand in any way, so you have to be pack them properly, ie. as overstuffing them will likely create pressure and tear at the zippers. I've read posts where users said the zippers failed, so I wanted to be sure to mention that the ABS plastic does really well, but the rigidity is compromised if the suitcase is overstuffed and unbalanced. Proper packing is crucial, especially when flying. Handles work well. The rubber underside of the handles on the top or side (cushy for comfort) might become sticky with extreme heat and over the course of many years. Walls are of normal thinness given that they are lightweight, so don't expect these will thwart major accidental damage like piercing or collisions/major drops.  Wheels remain undamaged and continue to work well, but those are always the most fragile for suitcases these days. I think they are always going to be the most likely part to damage given that people want 360 degree spinning wheels for comfort. You will always be obligated not to dump a heavy suitcase onto the wheels for transport on concrete. Safe travels!

author: Donna S. Caudill
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2019
review_content: We bought this luggage for our recent trip to Las Vegas since our 20+ year old luggage was getting hard to zip without the pull tabs on the zipper.  The 3 pieces showed up in 1 box, nestled inside of each other and was pretty light considering the box held 3 pieces.  For our trip, we used the large and medium sizes.  My husband and I were staying for about 10 days in Vegas, and I always pack more than I need.  The majority of our clothing fit in the larger case and when it was weighed at the airport, it was about 60 lbs.  Luckily, we were flying first class or it would have cost us extra.  I don't remember the weight of the smaller one, but it was much lighter.  On the flight out, with no layovers, the luggage came off the plane with no problems.  The TSA locks were built in, so no need to fumble with keys.  It was also easy to change the code on the luggage.  While in Vegas, I shopped a bit.  As we were packing to leave, hubby didn't think it would all fit (we have previously bought additional luggage to bring purchases home!).  It even get the cases to zip closed, I had to sit on the case while i zipped it closed.  Hubby swore that the case would not make it home without busting, it was that full!  At the airport, both cases were flagged as heavy, but both were under the 70 lb limits.  On the flight home, we had to change planes, so luggage was thrown around between planes.  When we finally made it home and was waiting for the luggage to come off of the plane, we were wondering if all of our stuff would come off the plane in a bin and the luggage opened.  However, when it came down the conveyor belt, it was still in one piece, a little bit scuffed, but unopened.  The luggage held up great!  No issues with the zipper bursting or any crack of any kind on the cases.  Both pieces of the luggage were so full, they were hard to zip close.  And they held up.  Very happy with how these held up for the trip.  They maneuvered easily through the airports, with swivel wheels on all pieces.  Highly recommend for the price!

author: susan piper
